x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Old water pipes and utility systems often have hidden leaks that waste a lot of clean water every day. This wasted water is called "Non-Revenue Water" because it never reaches customers and can't be billed. It's a huge loss not just of water, but also of energy and money. The problem is, utility companies don’t have a quick and organized way to find these leaks or send repair teams to fix them efficiently.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: Water Sentinel: Smart Leak & Water Loss Response
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

A central platform that turns leak reports and sensor data into prioritized, dispatchable repair jobs:

  • Citizen App (Mobile Portal): People can quickly report a visible leak (with a photo and location), turning a common complaint into a vital piece of data.
  • Smart Work Dispatch (Field Service Management): The system automatically categorizes the leak report, checks the location against pipe infrastructure data, and sends the closest available maintenance crew directly to the site using the shortest route.
  • Sensor Integration: Connects to Internet of Things (IoT) sensors already installed in the pipes. If a sensor detects low pressure, the system automatically creates an emergency repair ticket.
  • Impact Tracking: Dashboards show the "Water Saved" (in liters) and the "Time to Repair," proving the immediate environmental and financial benefits.
